content:
That's the spirit! Remember to start with a warm-up to get your blood flowing and muscles ready for the workout. You can do some light cardio like jumping jacks, jogging in place, or cycling in place for 5-10 minutes.

Now, let's get started with your workout!

**Squats:**

1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes facing forward or slightly outward.
2. Engage your core muscles and keep your back straight.
3. Lower your body down into a squat, keeping your weight in your heels, not your toes.
4. Push through your heels to return to standing.
5. Repeat for 12 reps.
6. Rest for 30-60 seconds.
7. Repeat for 2 more sets.

**Push-ups:**

1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core muscles and keep your body straight from head to heels.
3. Lower your body down until your chest almost touches the ground.
4. Push back up to the starting position.
5. Repeat for 12 reps.
6. Rest for 30-60 seconds.
7. Repeat for 2 more sets.

**Lunges:**

1. Stand with your feet together, take a large step forward with one foot, and lower your body down into a lunge.
2. Keep your front knee bent at a 90-degree angle and your back knee almost touching the ground.
3. Push through your front heel to return to standing.
4. Alternate legs with each rep.
5. Repeat for 12 reps (6 per leg).
6. Rest for 30-60 seconds.
7. Repeat for 2 more sets.

**Planks:**

1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core muscles and keep your body straight from head to heels.
3. Hold the plank position for 30-60 seconds.
4. Rest for 30-60 seconds.
5. Repeat for 2 more sets.

**Mountain Climbers:**

1. Start in a plank position, then bring one knee up towards your chest and quickly switch to the other knee.
2. Mimic the motion of running, keeping your core muscles engaged and your body straight.
3. Continue for 30-60 seconds.
4. Rest for 30-60 seconds.
5. Repeat for 2 more sets.

Remember to cool down after your workout with some static stretches to help your muscles recover. Focus on stretching your legs, glutes, and core muscles.

You're doing great! Keep pushing yourself and remember to listen to your body. If you need any adjustments or have any questions, feel free to ask.
